Cookbook:Ukrainian Cornmeal Stuffing (Na.desc: Nachynka in Ukrainian literally means stuffing. This dish is usually not stuffed inside anything, but served as a side dish.
Cookbook:Ukrainian Cornmeal Stuffing (Na.Ingredients:
1/2 cup (125 g / 4.4 oz) butter
1 cup (140 g / 4.9 oz) cornmeal
3 cups (750 ml / 1.6 pints) homogenized milk
2 large eggs
1 tsp salt
 1/2 tsp sugar
1 tsp baking powder
Butter
Cookbook:Ukrainian Cornmeal Stuffing (Na.Procedure:
Preheat oven to 350degF (175degC).
Melt butter in a pot on medium heat.
Add cornmeal. Stir mixture to warm up the cornmeal.
Add milk. Stir until mixture has thickened.
Beat eggs. Beat in salt, sugar, and baking powder.
Slowly add some of the thickened cornmeal mixture to the egg mixture while mixing to temper the eggs.
Stir the egg mixture into the rest of the cornmeal.
Pour the mixture into a greased casserole dish.
Bake at 350degF (175degC) for 30-40 minutes or until the top has browned.
Cookbook:Ukrainian Cornmeal Stuffing (Na.Notes, tips, and variations:
While you are thickening the cornmeal mixture, you have enough time to beat the eggs.
Doubling the recipe will yield enough to fill a 2 litre casserole dish.
For different flavour variations:
Mix in a  1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon.
Chop up a small onion and cook till tender in the butter, before adding cornmeal.
Cookbook:Ukrainian Cornmeal Stuffing (Na.Warnings: Do not add the egg mixture to the cornmeal. Some of the eggs will cook on impact resulting in streaks of cooked eggs and a heavier Nachynka.

Cookbook:Ume-shu (Japanese Plum Juice).desc: Ume juice is extracted by preserving the fruits in sugar. It tastes sweet, smooth, and acidic, and is a refreshing drink, often enjoyed in the summer. The taste and aroma of ume-shu can appeal to even those people who normally dislike the taste of alcohol.
Cookbook:Ume-shu (Japanese Plum Juice).Ingredients:
1 kg raw Japanese ume plums
1 kg rock sugar
Honey to taste
White liquor to taste
Cookbook:Ume-shu (Japanese Plum Juice).Procedure:
Wash plums and wipe dry.
Cram plums tightly into container with rock sugar. Add liquor if using.
Pour honey into container on top of ume.
Seal container, and leave in a cool, dark place until the plums are shriveled and leathery.
Remove fruit from container.
To drink, dilute the plum liquid with two times as much water.
Cookbook:Ume-shu (Japanese Plum Juice).Notes, tips, and variations: Keep in a cool place during summer.
